title: About me
text:
Hi! I’m Yao Lu, a Master of Business Analytics student at Monash University.
I enjoy turning messy data into clear, decision-ready stories. I work mainly in R (tidyverse, ggplot2), Quarto, and Git/GitHub; I’m also comfortable with Python and SQL.

Skills

Data wrangling & visualisation (tidyverse, ggplot2, gt)
Communicating with Data (Quarto, cross-refs, citations)
Reproducible workflows (Git/GitHub)
Basic Python & SQL for analytics


This site is built with Quarto and published via GitHub Pages as part of ETC5523 – Communicating with Data.

title: Welcome To My Blog Template
text: This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

title: ETC5523 Blog Assessment

title: Has climate change raised extreme bushfire weather risk in SE Australia?
text:
Australia’s 2019–20 “Black Summer” killed 34 people, destroyed thousands of homes, and caused major environmental damage.
This post asks a simple, public-facing question:

> Has human-driven climate change increased the chance of extreme fire weather in south-east Australia?
Researchers comparing today’s climate with a pre-industrial world find that the chance of an extreme Fire Weather Index (FWI) season is now about 30% higher.
